comment: Dr. Odum-Hinmon is very knowledgeable about writing. She is very good at explaining what is needed to succeed in the class. She responds quickly to emails. She gives feedback so students know how improve their writing. She provides examples of her work in the field to give students real-world examples of what we are learning about in class.

Generally, her lectures were kind of boring. While you can tell she cares a LOT about her students, she provides minimal to no feedback on assignments. The quizzes were a lot more difficult than expected. Her course seems easy on paper, but she grades relatively harshly. She does have lots of extra credit opportunities though. Does not round up.

Dr. Odum-Hinmon seems to really care about her students and the field of journalism. She has helped me improve my writing in her class, and she has given me advice that helped my writing in other classes. I like her examples from her experiences at several major newspapers.

Honestly I reached out to Ms. O through email and she does reply but honestly is not helpful. You need the textbook to pass the class, there is no type of teaching going on in this class, you read from the textbook, the powerpoint arent even hers and are old She is a tough grader, I got a 79 and I knew she wouldnt give me an 80, she sucks honestly

I found Dr. Odum-Hinmon to be very helpful when asked about assignments before they were due. She always responded quickly to emails. The recorded video presentations that were used due to Covid were extremely helpful in explaining the lesson and giving concrete examples similar to upcoming assignments. Her quizzes allotted more time than most.

She is an extremely tough grader and doesn't even teach. She just uses old powerpoints and videos that aren't even hers. Doesn't really help much. Weekly quizzes that are usually like 4 questions and are super hard. I took this class as an elective and it's literally my hardest class. Don't take!!

Very tough grader for what's supposed to be an easy class. Says textbook isn't required but every assignment & quizzes are very textbook heavy. If you don't buy it you wont pass no doubt. I only took this class for elective credits but she made it very hard & tedious for no reason. Doesn't really teach, just reads off powerpoints. Don't recommend.

I honestly wouldn't take this class again. It was rather difficult, the quizzes gave me a headache honestly .She really doesn't even teach AT ALL. It's other PowerPoints from like years ago and they dont even help honestly. Dont take her

Maria Odum-Hinmon is very soft-spoken and sweet. She has a lot of background in journalism and knows what she is talking about. Gives great feedback and open to helping students in the class and out. Do the work ask question and go to class and you will do well.

Dr. Odum-Hinmon isnt tough, the content is. She gives great feedback on assignments and through e-mails. The information in this class is not common sense, so it requires study. However, the workload is minimal. You absolutely need the textbook, the class is basically built around it. If you do your part, you will gain a lot from this professor.
If you turn in your assignments, proofread your work, and participate in class, you should make an A. We did practice assignments in class before the real assignments were due.
This professor was very fair and allowed us to rewrite our stories for a higher grade after giving feedback. She gave lots of real-world examples of covering news stories.

Professor Odum-Hinmon talks very quietly and slowly. She doesnt seem to have a plan for class and just reads out loud from the text book. She is unclear about work assignments and barely even talks about them before they are due. I do not recommend taking this professor.
